pullRequest.title: Rework the prepared statement cache and evict the statement from the …
pullRequest.bodyText:
…cache when it's closed - fixes #572
Motivation:
fixes #572 based on changes after #577.
Conformance:
Your commits should be signed and you should have signed the Eclipse Contributor Agreement as explained in https://github.com/eclipse/vert.x/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
Please also make sure you adhere to the code style guidelines: https://github.com/vert-x3/wiki/wiki/Vert.x-code-style-guidelines

commit.message:
rework the prepared statement cache and evict the statement from the cache when it's closed - fixes #572

Signed-off-by: Billy Yuan <billy112487983@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: why do we cache the AsyncResult<PreparedStatement> and not the PreparedStatement instead ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@

+
+package io.vertx.sqlclient.impl.cache;
+
+import io.vertx.core.AsyncResult;
+import io.vertx.core.Handler;
+import io.vertx.sqlclient.impl.PreparedStatement;
+
+import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * A LRU replacement strategy cache based on {@link java.util.LinkedHashMap} for prepared statements.
+ */
+class LruCache extends LinkedHashMap<String, AsyncResult<PreparedStatement>> {

commit.message:
prepared statement cache will only cache successful responses now

Signed-off-by: Billy Yuan <billy112487983@gmail.com>

evict the invalid prepared statement when the postgres table is changed - fixes #619

Signed-off-by: Billy Yuan <billy112487983@gmail.com>

remove unnecessary lines

Signed-off-by: Billy Yuan <billy112487983@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: For now can we move this to the io.vertx.sqlclient.impl.codec package and rename to InvalidCachedStatementEvent because such detection could happen without the execution of a statement. Instead of the PreparedStatement just provide the statement identifier so it can be removed from the cache.

commit.message:
use sql string as the prepared statement cache entry removing identifier and some minors for naming

Signed-off-by: Billy Yuan <billy112487983@gmail.com>
